frameDefinitions: This frame concerns Acts and State_of_
This frame describes means actions (Preparatory_acts) that are taken by an Agent for the purpose of preparing for a later act.

An Agent is involved in an activity whose degree of success is dependent on a parameter of the action matching a particular set of values of a continuous variable or variables (e.g. quantity, location, time).
An Agent or Cause limits a Range_of_options to having a certain Characteristic.
This frame concerns a specific subset of Instances of a Type which are evaluated in terms of their similarity to a conceptual prototype of the Type.
An Agent displays a Characteristic of a Standard in his or her own way of behaving.
frameExamples: A lot of people suspect that blocking savers' access to their money <t>violates</t> the new constitution's explicit ban on compulsory loans to the government.
This update lays the <t>groundwork</t> for future improvements.
The Longview Rangefinder is <t>accurate</t> to within one foot per hundred yards .
His choices in life have <t>limited</t> his opportunities severely.
I guessed he was trying to <t>imitate</t> the movements of a skier
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Protagonist</fen>'s behavior is in or out of compliance with norms.
This role identifies the <fen>Act</fen> that is judged to be in or out of compliance with the <fen>Norm</fen>s.
A <fen>State_of_affairs</fen> may violate a law or rule.
This role identifies the rules or <fen>Norm</fen>s that ought to guide a person's behavior.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen>  when the act of compliance or non-compliance occurs.
The <fen>Agent</fen> uses the <fen>Preparatory_act</fen> to acheive a <fen>Purpose</fen>.
The action performed by the Agent that is a preliminary to the achievement of the <fen>Purpose</fen>. The <fen>Preparatory_act</fen> may also be expressed by a result of such an act.
The ultimate goal or purpose of the <fen>Agent</fen>, which the Preparatory_act enables.
The part of the larger process that is preliminary to the achievement of the <fen>Purpose</fen>.
The time at which the <fen>Preparatory_act</fen> takes place.
The place where the <fen>Preparatory_act</fen> takes place.
The individual who tries to interact with the <fen>Target</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Means</fen> by which the <fen>Agent</fen> attempts to hit a <fen>Target_value</fen>.
How closely the expected or actual location that the <fen>Instrument</fen> interacts with corresponds to the <fen>Target_value</fen>.
The object manipulated by the <fen>Agent</fen> in order to interact with the <fen>Target</fen>.
Expected or actual deviation from the <fen>Target_value</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when something hits or misses.
The place where the <fen>Agent</fen> manages or fails to interact with the <fen>Target</fen>.
The <fen>Agent</fen> consciously places limits upon the Range_of_options.
The <fen>Cause</fen> is a natural occurrence or state-of-affairs that limits the Range_of_options.

The <fen>Range_of_options</fen> would normally be expected to have a set of possibilites, but is limited by an <fen>Agent</fen> or <fen>Cause</fen> to particular subtypes, situations or characteristics.
The <fen>Characteristic</fen> indicates the subtypes or situations to which the <fen>Range_of_options</fen> is limited.
The time at which the limiting takes place.
The location in which the <fen>Agent</fen> or <fen>Cause</fen> limits the <fen>Range_of_options</fen>.
A thing or episode that is considered exemplary of a certain <fen>Type</fen>.
The category of things or events from which an <fen>Instance</fen> is picked out.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the person that borrows a <fen>Characteristic</fen> behavior from a <fen>Standard</fen>.
The <fen>Characteristic</fen> is a behavior or property that the <fen>Standard</fen> possesses and which the <fen>Agent</fen> adopts in his or her own behavior.
The <fen>Standard</fen> is the entity that exhibits a certain <fen>Characteristic</fen> that the <fen>Agent</fen> models their own behavior on.
The time at which the imitation occurs.
The location where the <fen>Agent</fen> imitates some entity which acts as a <fen>Standard</fen>.
listRoleExamples: Jo's <fex><t>violation</t></fex> of the no trespassing law came as a surprise.
John violated <fex>the law</fex> by not paying taxes.
<fex>The company's actions at that stage</fex> were simply preliminary to the takeover.
We are still in the preliminary <fex>phases</fex>.
<fex>The mailman</fex> is very exact about addresses -- he has to be .
For this they would need a thermometer accurate <fex>to within a microkelvin</fex>.
<fex>The military</fex> limited building access to key personnel.
<fex>Ongoing rains</fex> have limited drivers to a small number of roads.
The military limited <fex>building access</fex> to key personnel.
The military limited access <fex>to key personnel only</fex>.
Banks are <fex>currently</fex> limiting customers to two cash transactions per day.
Mimic Snotlings do n't really think for themselves, <fex>they</fex> merely mimic the actions of Orcs and Goblins around them.
The singer says Gwen has copied <fex>her</fex> in many different ways.
